Package com.lambdaschool.webemployees

Class EmployeeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lambdaschool.webemployees.EmployeeController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/data")
public class EmployeeController
extends java.lang.Object
    The entry point for clients to access employee data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllEmployees()
      Returns a list of all employees
      Example: http://localhost:8080/data/allemployees
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEmpDetail​(long id)
      Returns the information for a given employee
      Example: http://localhost:8080/data/employee/2
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEmployees​(char letter)
      Returns a list of employees whose first name starts with the given letter
      Example: http://localhost:8080/data/employees/s
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getSortedEmployees​(char letter)
      Returns a list of employees whose first name starts with the given letter sorted by salary from smallest to largest
      Example: http://localhost:8080/data/sortedemployees/s

    • Method Detail

      • getAllEmployees

        @GetMapping(value="/allemployees",
            produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllEmployees()
        Returns a list of all employees
        Example: http://localhost:8080/data/allemployees
        Returns:
        JSON list of all employees order alphabetically by first name with a status of OK.

      • getEmpDetail

        @GetMapping(value="/employee/{id}",
            produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEmpDetail​(@PathVariable
                                                               long id)
        Returns the information for a given employee
        Example: http://localhost:8080/data/employee/2
        Parameters:
        id - The employee's id whose information you are seeking
        Returns:
        JSON object of the employee you seek with a status of OK

      • getEmployees

        @GetMapping(value="/employees/{letter}",
            produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEmployees​(@PathVariable
                                                               char letter)
        Returns a list of employees whose first name starts with the given letter
        Example: http://localhost:8080/data/employees/s
        Parameters:
        letter - The first letter of the first name of the employees you seek. Case insensitive.
        Returns:
        JSON list of the employees you seek with a status of OK

      • getSortedEmployees

        @GetMapping(value="/sortedemployees/{letter}",
            produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getSortedEmployees​(@PathVariable
                                                                     char letter)
        Returns a list of employees whose first name starts with the given letter sorted by salary from smallest to largest
        Example: http://localhost:8080/data/sortedemployees/s
        Parameters:
        letter - The first letter of the first name of the employees you seek. Case insensitive.
        Returns:
        JSON list of the employees you seek sorted by salary from smallest to largest with a status of OK
